title: Cobnut, pear and sticky toffee tart
description: Kentish cobs are cultivated hazelnuts, often larger than the wild variety, and easier to gather. Crunchy and sweet, they partner apples and pears perfectly in this autumnal, nutty, treacly tart.Equipment and preparation: for this recipe you will need a 25cm/10in fluted tart tin (3.5cm/1¼in deep).
ingredients: 100g/3½oz unsalted butter, chilled, cut into 1cm/½in cubes
3 ripe medium pears (approximately 500g/1lb 2oz),  peeled, quartered and cored
100g/3½oz shelled cobnuts or hazelnuts, roughly chopped
